rounds.response:
[White] Black has played [e7e6], which is a solid but somewhat defensive move in the French Defense style, challenging my central control indirectly. To maintain pressure and further occupy the center, I'll advance my d-pawn to d4, opening lines for my queen and bishop while preparing to develop my pieces. This move also sets up potential tactics like the e4-e5 push later.

My move is: [d2d4]

rounds.response:
[White] Black's move [e7e6] is a classic French Defense setup, aiming to challenge my central pawn on e4 while preparing to develop their pieces. To counter this effectively, I'll advance my d-pawn to d4, seizing more central space, opening lines for my queen and light-squared bishop, and putting pressure on Black's position. This also supports potential future expansions like e4-e5.

My move is: [d2d4]
